item.title: 美国劳工委员会选择不为禁止特朗普解雇民主党成员的法律辩护
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）试图罢免一名民主党成员，而负责执行私营部门工人劳动权利的美国机构正放弃对禁止总统随意罢免被任命者的法律进行法律辩护。【原文：The U.S. agency that enforces the labor rights of private-sector workers is abandoning its legal defense of a law barring the president from removing appointees at will, as President Donald Trump seeks to oust a Democratic member.】

item.title: 特朗普政府推出新的 "自我驱逐 "应用程序
item.description: 特朗普政府周一推出了一款新的应用程序，允许在美国非法居留的移民 "自行递解出境"，而不是面临可能的逮捕和拘留。【原文：The Trump administration rolled out a new app on Monday that will allow immigrants in the United States illegally to "self deport" rather than face possible arrest and detention, building on President Donald Trump's deportation push.】

item.title: 美国最高法院驳回各州对石油公司提起气候诉讼的质疑
item.description: 美国最高法院周一驳回了以阿拉巴马州为首的 19 个共和党领导的州提出的要求，即阻止五个民主党领导的州提起诉讼，指控大型石油公司在化石燃料导致气候变化的问题上欺骗公众。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court rejected on Monday a bid by 19 Republican-led states led by Alabama to block five Democratic-led states from pursuing lawsuits accusing major oil companies of deceiving the public about the role fossil fuels have played in causing climate change.】

item.title: 美国最高法院将审理对科罗拉多州同性恋 "转换疗法 "禁令的质疑
item.description: 美国最高法院周一同意审理一名基督教治疗师以言论自由为由对民主党支持的科罗拉多州法律提出的质疑，该法律禁止旨在改变未成年人性取向或性别认同的 "转换疗法"。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear a Christian therapist's challenge on free speech grounds to a Democratic-backed Colorado law banning "conversion therapy" intended to change a minor's sexual orientation or gender identity.】

item.title: 最高外交官卢比奥说，特朗普政府取消了美国国际开发署 80% 以上的项目
item.description: 美国国务卿马可-卢比奥（Marco Rubio）周一表示，特朗普政府在经过为期六周的审查后，取消了美国国际开发署 80% 以上的项目。【原文：The Trump administration has canceled more than 80 percent of all the programs at U.S. Agency for International Development following a six-week review, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Monday.】

item.title: 白宫官员预计第一季度 GDP 将 "勉强 "进入正增长类别
item.description: 白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）周一表示，他预计唐纳德-特朗普总统贸易政策的不确定性将在四月初得到解决，并预测第一季度国内生产总值数据将是积极的。【原文：White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett on Monday said he expected uncertainty about President Donald Trump's trade policies to be resolved in early April, and predicted first quarter GDP data would be positive.】

item.title: 美国的猫鼬数量不足 100 只--这些科学家正在努力拯救它们
item.description: 在拯救濒临灭绝的猫鼬的竞赛中，科学家们跋涉美国，寻求生育治疗方法，努力启动新一代野生猫鼬。【原文：In the race to save the endangered ocelot, scientists are trekking the United States, pursuing fertility treatments and striving to kickstart a new generation of the wild cat.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结美国农业部开支，农民搁置计划和投资
item.description: 蒙大拿州贝尔格莱德外的有机农场主 Nate Powell-Palm 依靠美国农业部农业营销服务部提供的 64.8 万美元赠款，帮助建立了一家饲料厂，这是该地区约 150 名有机谷物农场主的经济命脉。【原文：Nate Powell-Palm, an organic farmer outside Belgrade, Montana, was relying on a $648,000 grant from USDA's Agricultural Marketing Service to help build a feed mill - an economic lifeline for about 150 area organic grain farmers.】

item.title: 国会共和党人寻求团结在避免政府关门的议案周围
item.description: 共和党控制的美国国会本周似乎将继续推进为政府提供资金的工作，以避免从周六开始的部分停摆，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统削减联邦机构的快速举动令华盛顿备受震撼。【原文：The Republican-controlled U.S. Congress looked set to move ahead this week to keep the government funded and avert a partial shutdown beginning on Saturday, as Washington is rocked by President Donald Trump's rapid moves to slash federal agencies.】

item.title: 特朗普称政府有可能停摆，但有望避免停摆
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周日表示，如果众议院无法获得足够票数通过临时拨款法案，政府关门 "可能会发生"，但他仍对该法案获得批准持乐观态度。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday that a government shutdown "could happen" if the House of Representatives cannot muster enough votes to pass a temporary funding bill, but he remains optimistic the measure will get approved.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国正就出售 TikTok 事宜与四家不同集团商谈
item.description: 前洛杉矶道奇队老板弗兰克-麦考特表示了兴趣。【原文：Former LA Dodgers owner Frank McCourt has expressed interest.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国 "即将 "结束暂停共享乌克兰情报的做法
item.description: 在美国停止对基辅的军事援助之后，乌克兰又暂停了对俄罗斯的军事援助，这可能会损害乌克兰抵御俄罗斯导弹袭击的能力，从而导致生命损失。【原文：The suspension, which could cost lives by hurting Ukraine's ability to defend itself against Russian missile strikes, followed a halt to U.S. military aid to Kyiv.】

item.title: 小型飞机坠入宾夕法尼亚州退休社区停车场
item.description: 据当局称，一架载有五人的小型飞机于周日坠毁在宾夕法尼亚州兰开斯特一个退休社区的停车场内。【原文：A small plane with five people aboard crashed on Sunday into the parking lot of a retirement community in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, authorities said.】

item.title: 学生称当局逮捕了哥伦比亚大学的巴勒斯坦示威学生
item.description: 对研究生马哈茂德-哈利勒（Mahmoud Khalil）的拘留似乎是唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）为兑现其寻求驱逐一些参与亲巴勒斯坦抗议运动的外国学生的承诺而做出的首批努力之一。【原文：The detention of graduate student Mahmoud Khalil appears to be one of the first efforts by Donald Trump to fulfill his promise to seek the deportation of some foreign students involved in the pro-Palestinian protest movement.】

item.title: 国土安全部任命移民及海关执法局（ICE）新领导层，递解出境工作步履维艰
item.description: 国土安全部长克里斯蒂-诺姆（Kristi Noem）周日任命了美国移民和海关执法局（U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement）的新领导层，因为该机构正在努力实现唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统提出的针对非法居留美国的移民开展大规模驱逐行动的目标。【原文：Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem appointed new leadership at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement on Sunday as the agency struggles to meet President Donald Trump's stated goal of massive deportation operations aimed at immigrants in the U.S. illegally.】

item.title: 备忘录称退伍军人事务部最早将于 6 月开始大规模裁员
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的一份备忘录，退伍军人事务部最早将于 6 月开始在这个政治敏感的机构进行大规模裁员。【原文：The Department of Veterans Affairs will begin mass layoffs at the politically sensitive agency as early as June, according to a memo reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国商务部长卢特尼克表示，特朗普不会放松与芬太尼相关的关税
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周日表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普不会放松对墨西哥、加拿大和中国因处理芬太尼而征收关税的压力。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump will not let up his pressure on tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China related to their handling of fentanyl, U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Sunday.】

item.title: 美国特勤局称一夜之间在白宫附近击毙持枪男子
item.description: 美国特勤局在一份声明中说，周日早些时候在白宫外发生冲突后，特勤局向一名持枪男子开枪，目前该男子正在当地医院接受治疗。【原文：The U.S. Secret Service shot an armed man outside the White House early on Sunday after a confrontation, and the man is now in an area hospital, it said in a statement.】

item.title: 肯塔基州将城市露营定为犯罪，"无家可归者法庭 "试图逃避惩罚
item.description: 肯塔基州去年通过了一项露营禁令，因为无家可归者和露营者的队伍不断壮大，令该州感到沮丧。随之而来的是人类的后果。【原文：The state of Kentucky passed a camping ban last year, frustrated by the growing ranks of homeless people and their encampments. Then came the human consequences.】

item.title: 肯塔基州将城市露营定为犯罪，"无家可归者法庭 "试图逃避惩罚
item.description: 肯塔基州去年通过了一项露营禁令，因为无家可归者和露营者的队伍不断壮大，令该州感到沮丧。随之而来的是人类的后果。【原文：The state of Kentucky passed a camping ban last year, frustrated by the growing ranks of homeless people and their encampments. Then came the human consequences.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州麻疹疫情爆发，家长抵制疫苗接种，医生反击
item.description: 安娜-蒙塔尼兹博士正在拉伯克加班加点地联系那些对疫苗犹豫不决的家长，向他们解释一种大多数美国家庭从未见过的疾病所带来的严重风险，而这种疾病是可以通过免疫接种来预防的。【原文：Dr. Ana Montanez is working overtime in Lubbock to contact vaccine-hesitant parents, explaining the grave risks posed by a disease that most American families have never seen, and one that can be prevented through immunization.】

item.title: 美国众议院共和党人推出为期六个月的临时拨款法案以避免停摆
item.description: 控制美国众议院的共和党人周六公布了为期六个月的临时拨款法案，如果该法案获得国会通过，将避免政府在 3 月 14 日关门，并将目前的政府拨款延长至 2025 财年。【原文：Republicans who control the U.S. House of Representatives unveiled their six-month stopgap funding bill on Saturday, which if passed by Congress would avert a government shutdown on March 14 and extend current government funding through fiscal year 2025.】

item.title: 司法部解雇有组织犯罪缉毒工作组组长
item.description: "亚当-科恩（Adam Cohen）在 LinkedIn 上写道："把坏人关进监狱是最不带政治色彩的事情。【原文："Putting bad guys in jail was as apolitical as it gets," Adam Cohen wrote on LinkedIn.】

item.title: 专家称，特朗普针对律师事务所的命令引发宪法关切
item.description: 他们说，这些命令也可能是对过去与他作对的律师的特殊报复行为。【原文：The orders also may represent exceptional acts of retribution against lawyers who have crossed him in the past, they said.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，疾控中心计划对疫苗和自闭症进行研究
item.description: 目前还不清楚长期宣传反疫苗观点的卫生部长小罗伯特-肯尼迪（Robert F. Kennedy Jr）是否参与了计划中的研究，也不清楚研究将如何进行。【原文：It is unclear whether Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr, who has long promoted anti-vaccine views, is involved in the planned study or how it would be carried out.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚大学承诺解决特朗普政府在 4 亿美元资金被撤回后的担忧
item.description: 哥伦比亚大学临时校长表示，学校正在努力解决美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府的 "合理关切"，此前该校因校园反犹太主义指控而被取消了联邦政府的 4 亿美元拨款和合同。【原文：Columbia University's interim president said the school is working to address the "legitimate concerns" of U.S. President Donald Trump's administration after $400 million of federal government grants and contracts to the university were canceled over allegations of antisemitism on campus.】

item.title: 南卡罗来纳州执行美国 15 年来首次行刑队死刑
item.description: 南卡罗来纳州周五用行刑队处决了一名被定罪的杀人犯，这是美国15年来首次使用这种方式。【原文：South Carolina executed a convicted murderer by firing squad on Friday, the first use of the method in the United States in 15 years.】

item.title: 据 Politico 报道，美国卫生部长肯尼迪下周将会见食品公司负责人
item.description: 美国卫生与公众服务部部长小罗伯特-肯尼迪（Robert F. Kennedy Jr.）计划于 3 月 10 日会见通用磨坊（General Mills）和百事可乐（PepsiCo）等知名食品公司的高管。【原文：U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services Robert F. Kennedy Jr. plans to meet with senior executives from leading food companies like General Mills and PepsiCo on March 10, Politico reported on Saturday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 民主党领导的各州加入针对特朗普大规模解雇联邦工作人员的法律斗争
item.description: 纽约州总检察长和其他 19 个州的总检察长周四晚间对特朗普政府大规模解雇部分联邦工作人员提起诉讼，这是各州政府首次加入到与总统削减官僚机构的努力有关的法律斗争中。【原文：New York’s attorney general and 19 others filed a lawsuit Thursday night against the Trump administration’s mass firings of some federal workers, the first entry of states into the legal fight over the president’s efforts to slash the bureaucracy.】

item.title: 非政府环保组织就资金冻结问题起诉特朗普的环保局和花旗银行
item.description: 这是非营利组织、州检察长和其他人士提起的一系列诉讼中的最新一起。【原文：It is the latest in a scores of cases filed by nonprofit groups, state attorneys general and others.】
